According to the artificial intelligence device capable of monitoring the agriculture and forestry diseases and insect pests, the probes can be driven to rotate certain angles simultaneously through the relation that the annular grooves in one sides of the two rotating devices are mutually engaged, then power can be provided for rotating of therotating devices through cooperation of a motor, first gears and a second gear, and thus the situation of the agriculture and forestry diseases and pests can be automatically monitored.

title: Agro-ecological multi-source heterogeneous big data collection, processing and analysis architecture
abstract: The invention discloses an agro-ecological multi-source heterogeneous big data collection, processing and analysis architecture, and relates to the technical field of artificial intelligence and datamining analysis. The architecture comprises a data acquisition module, the data acquisition module is electrically connected to a data storage module, the data storage module is electrically connectedto a data preprocessing module, the data preprocessing module is electrically connected to a data feature extraction module, the data feature extraction module is electrically connected to a parallelmining and analysis module, and the parallel mining and analysis module is electrically connected to an environment prediction and display module. The architecture is used for conducting collection,processing, analysis and other treatment steps on agro-ecological multi-source heterogeneous big data, and therefore omni-directional monitoring of ecological agriculture in an observation area is achieved; the architecture helps staff to judge the specific production condition of the ecological agriculture in the observation area according to an analysis result and is very conducive to promotingthe development of ecological agriculture.

title: METHOD FOR PREDICTION OF SOIL AND/OR PLANT CONDITION
abstract: Provided is a method for prediction of soil and/or plant condition. The present invention relates to a method and system for predicting soil and/or plant condition in precision agriculture with a classification of measurement data for providing an assignment of a measurement parcel to classes of interest according to claim 1 and claim 8, respectively, particularly wherein the assignment is used for providing action recommendations, particularly in real time or close to real time, to a farmer and/or to an agricultural device based on acquired measurement data, particularly remote sensing data,and a classification model is trained by a machine learning algorithm, e.g. relying on deep learning for supervised and/or unsupervised learning, and is potentially continuously refined and adapted thanks to a feedback procedure.

title: METHOD FOR PREDICTION OF SOIL AND/OR PLANT CONDITION
abstract: A method and system for predicting soil and/or plant condition in precision agriculture with a classification of measurement data for providing an assignment of a measurement parcel to classes of interest. The assignment is used for providing action recommendations, particularly in real time or close to real time, to a farmer and/or to an agricultural device based on acquired measurement data, particularly remote sensing data, and wherein a classification model is trained by a machine learning algorithm, e.g. relying on deep learning for supervised and/or unsupervised learning, and is potentially continuously refined and adapted thanks to a feedback procedure.

title: Agricultural pest detection method based on regional convolution neural network
abstract: The invention provides an agricultural pest detection method based on a regional convolution neural network and relates to the technical fields of digital image processing, deep learning, computer vision and the like. The method comprises the following specific steps of 1) collecting and arranging various agricultural pest samples as a training set; 2) marking and labeling samples in the trainingset; 3) subjecting all collected samples in the agricultural pest training set to model training by means of a regional convolution neural network framework; 4) collecting a monitoring image in the farmland, and testing the monitoring image to obtain a final effect based on the obtained model. According to the method, agricultural pests are detected by the obtained model based on the regional convolution neural network, and the influence of agricultural pests on the agriculture, the forestry and the animal husbandry is reduced with the assistance of various pest prevention means. The yield ofagricultural grains is improved, and the greening safety of the forestry and the animal husbandry is protected. The method has a practical significance and is good in effect.

title: Agricultural Internet-of-things production process management system and realization method thereof
abstract: The invention discloses an agricultural Internet-of-things production process management system and a realization method thereof. The system comprises an agricultural information acquisition system, an agricultural information transmission system, an agricultural information processing system and an agricultural information query system, wherein the agricultural information acquisition system is used for sending the acquired agricultural information to the agricultural information processing system through the agricultural information transmission system, the agricultural information processing system is used for storing data in a cloud database, processing the data through utilizing the artificial intelligence technology, the agricultural information query system is used for carrying out traceablility check, the agricultural information acquisition system comprises a high-definition video monitoring module, an environment information monitoring module, a plantation data acquisition module, a material management module, a storage module and a sales module, the agricultural information processing system comprises an expert system module, and the agricultural information query system comprises a traceablility module. The system is advantaged in that management strength of the whole agricultural product production process is improved, traceablility data tracking management and query in the agricultural product production process are realized, and agricultural product production cost reduction, yield increase, efficiency increase, green agriculture development acceleration, agricultural product production standard improvement and production management system safety improvement are realized.

title: Convenient to use's artificial intelligence type orchard sprinkling irrigation equipment
abstract: The utility model discloses a convenient to use's artificial intelligence type orchard sprinkling irrigation equipment, including the equipment automobile body, the top of equipment automobile body is offered flutedly, and the cavity has been offered to the inside of equipment automobile body, and the cavity lies in the equipment automobile body under, and fixed inlaying has the bearing on the interior roof of cavity, fixedly connected with motor on the interior diapire of cavity, and the output fixedly connected with axis of rotation of motor, the one end that the motor was kept away from to the axis of rotation runs through the bearing and extends to in the recess. This convenient to use's artificial intelligence type orchard sprinkling irrigation equipment utilizes electric putter's flexible power, can carry out extrusion formula sprinkling irrigation operation to liquid, and labour saving and time saving has avoided the drawback of backpack operation, and it is more convenient to use, and the artificial intelligence degree is high, has guaranteed the rotary type sprinkling irrigation operation of shower nozzle, accords with the demand for development of modern intelligent agriculture and forestry, and it is efficient spray, can carry out effectual centre gripping to fixing to manage, has guaranteed the relative stability of fixed pipe and shower nozzle, stabilizes effectually.

title: СПОСОБ ФОРМИРОВАНИЯ РЕЗОНАНСНОЙ ДРЕВЕСИНЫ ЕЛИ ЕВРОПЕЙСКОЙ
BIG DATA SELF-LEARNING METHODOLOGY FOR THE ACCURATE QUANTIFICATION AND CLASSIFICATION OF SPECTRAL INFORMATION UNDER COMPLEX VARLABILITY AND MULTI-SCALE INTERFERENCE
applicants: INESC TEC INSTITUTO DE ENGENHARIA DE SIST E COMPUTADORES TECNOLOGIA E CIENCIA [PT]
abstract: The present disclosure relates to a big data self-learning artificial intelligence methodology for the accurate quantification of metabolites classification of health conditions from spectral information, where complex biological variability and multi-scale spectral interference is present. In particular, this invention allows the breakdown of highly complex biological spectral signals into high dimensional feature space where local features of each sub-space are accurately correlated with both a specific metabolite concentration or a categorical condition. Such is achieved by a new self-learning method, that requires no human intervention. The developed artificial intelligence is able to establish its own knowledgebase when new data is fed by performing feature space transformations, searching directions of co-variance and optimizing local composition-spectral correlations. These methods allow the artificial intelligence to establish knowledge maps of both quantifications and classifications, that can be cashed for higher computational performance. In particular, direct search comprises of finding across the feature space data and dimensions that allow a direct linear correspondence between metabolic composition and spectral bands variance. Moreover, a similar approach is derived for defining the convex hull regions of different class of health conditions from body fluid spectra. Such results in the creation of knowledge maps for both quantification and classification. The present invention also allows to evaluate 'a priori' the predictability, accuracy and precision of new estimates. Furthermore, this invention provides a self-learning approach to de definition of the global feature space using big data, for its correct characterization under high variability, accurate detection of local anomalies, as well as, outliers that can contaminate the knowledge base. This invention is applicable to all regions of the electro-magnetic spectra used in spectroscopy analysis (x-ray, uv, vis, nir, ir, far-ir and microwaves), or with any other type of spectroscopy (absorvance, reflectance, fluorescence, phosphorescence, Raman scattering) where complex multi-scale interference and biological variability is present. It further extends to fields of non-destructive, non-invasive spectroscopy applications in fields such as healthcare, veterinary, biotechnology, pharmaceutical, food and agriculture.

title: N-ALCOXYCARBONYLAMINOETHYL-N'-ARYL-UREA EXHIBITING GROWTH-REGULATING ACTIVITY
applicants: A N NESMEYANOV INST OF ORGANOELEMENT COMPOUNDS OF THE RUSSIAN ACAD OF SCIENCES (INEOS RAS) [RU]
abstract: FIELD: chemistry.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to a method for obtaining N-alkoxycarbonylaminoethyl-N'-aryl-urea of general formula I, where R=sec-CH, R=H, R=H, R=CH(Ia), R=sec-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=H (Ib), R=iso-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=CH(Iv), R=n-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=H (Ig), R=iso-CH, R=H, R=H, R=CH(Id), R=iso-CH, R=H, R=H, R=COOCH(Ie), R=sec-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=CH(Izh), which can be used in agriculture to increase the resistance of plants to unfavourable environmental factors. The method comprises reaction of the corresponding aromatic isocyanates with alkyl esters of β-aminoethylcarbamic acid in an inert solvent at room temperature, followed by isolation of the desired compounds of formula I by known methods. The invention also relates to the N-alkoxycarbonylaminoethyl-N'-aryl-urea of general formula I, where R=sec-CH, R=H, R=H, R=CH(Ia), R=sec-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=H (Ib), R= iso-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=CH(Iv), R=n-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=H (Ig), R= iso-CH, R=H, R=H, R=CH(Id), R=sec-CH, R=CH, R=H, R=CH(Izh), which can be used as plant growth regulators of anti-stress type.EFFECT: increased composition efficiency.5 cl, 7 tbl, 5 ex

title: Method and device for acquiring plant water deficit level
applicants: BEIJING RES CT INFORMATION TECH AGRICULTURE
abstract: The invention provides a method and device for acquiring the plant water deficit level. The method comprises the steps of 1, acquiring a grayscale image of a leaf; 2, and acquiring the plant water deficit level by using a hybrid deep learning network based on a rectangular image block of the grayscale image. According to the invention, the plant water deficit level is acquired quickly and accurately under the premise of not damaging the plant leaf, thus an appropriate precision irrigation measure can be adopted timely according to the plant water deficit level, and health growth of the plant is ensured. For crops, the yield of the crops and the quality of products can further be ensured according to the invention. In addition, real-time detection for the water deficit level can be performed on small-scale plants on site by applying the method to mobile terminals such as an intelligent mobile phone; and real-time detection for the water deficit level can also be performed on large-scale plants within video monitoring through applying the method to a computer.

title: Financial fraud behavior quantization detection system based on countryside e-commence big data deep learning
applicants: CHONGQING XIAOFU NONGKANG AGRICULTURE TECH SERVICE CO LTD
abstract: The invention discloses a financial fraud behavior quantization detection system based on countryside e-commence big data deep learning. Through establishing a model of countryside e-commence big data deep learning, characteristics of financial fraud behaviors in countryside e-commence big data are dug and the characteristics are input into an abnormal behavior detecting model, so that financial fraud behaviors can be identified effectively, quickly and accurately, fraud risk level can be quantized, prevention can be made in advance, and unnecessary loss due to financial fraud behaviors can be avoided.

title: User-friendly artificial intelligence type orchard sprinkler irrigation equipment
abstract: The invention discloses user-friendly artificial intelligence type orchard sprinkler irrigation equipment which comprises an equipment body. A groove is formed in the top of the equipment body, a cavity is formed in the equipment body and is located right under the equipment body, a bearing is fixedly embedded in the inner top wall of the cavity, a motor is fixedly connected on the inner bottom wall of the cavity, the output end of the motor is fixedly connected with a rotating shaft, and one end of the rotating shaft and away from the motor penetrates the bearing to extend to the groove. The user-friendly artificial intelligence type orchard sprinkler irrigation equipment has the advantages that extrusion type sprinkler irrigation operation can be performed on liquid by the aid of telescoping force of an electric drive pusher, time and labor are saved, the shortcoming about backpack operation is avoided, the equipment is more convenient and high in artificial intelligence, rotary sprinkler irrigation of a sprinkle nozzle is guaranteed, requirements of modern intelligent agriculture and forestry development is conformed, sprinkle efficiency is high, a fixing pipe can be effectively clamped, relative stability of the fixing pipe and the sprinkle nozzle is guaranteed, and good stability is achieved.

title: Text information-based Chinese fruit variety information extracting method and device
abstract: The invention provides a text information-based Chinese fruit variety information extracting method and a text information-based Chinese fruit variety information extracting device. The method comprises the following steps: crawling to download pages which are related to fruit through acquiring a corpus; performing corpus tagging on the pages which are related to the fruit; extracting lexical item pairs from the pages which are related to the fruit, and dividing the lexical item pairs into training corpus and test corpus; performing text structure-based remote feature extracting on the corpus; training to obtain a deep learning-based combined classifier by utilizing training corpus features; extracting fruit variety information from the test corpus by utilizing the combined classifier; dividing the pages which are related to the fruit into N groups, and executing repeatedly to acquire an assessment result. The information extracting technology at present is improved, so that the text information-based Chinese fruit variety information extracting method and the text information-based Chinese fruit variety information extracting device are more applicable to the field of agriculture; the accuracy of fruit variety name identifying and extracting is improved.

title: PREDICTION OF IN-FIELD DRY-DOWN OF A MATURE SMALL GRAIN, COARSE GRAIN, OR OILSEED CROP USING FIELD-LEVEL ANALYSIS AND FORECASTING OF WEATHER CONDITIONS AND CROP CHARACTERISTICS INCLUDING SAMPLED MOISTURE CONTENT
abstract: A modeling framework for evaluating the impact of weather conditions on farming and harvest operations applies real-time, field-level weather data and forecasts of meteorological and climatological conditions together with user-provided and/or observed feedback of a present state of a harvest-related condition to agronomic models and to generate a plurality of harvest advisory outputs for precision agriculture. A harvest advisory model simulates and predicts the impacts of this weather information and user-provided and/or observed feedback in one or more physical, empirical, or artificial intelligence models of precision agriculture to analyze crops, plants, soils, and resulting agricultural commodities, and provides harvest advisory outputs to a diagnostic support tool for users to enhance farming and harvest decision-making, whether by providing pre-, post-, or in situ-harvest operations and crop analyses.

title: MODELING OF TIME-VARIANT THRESHABILITY DUE TO INTERACTIONS BETWEEN A CROP IN A FIELD AND ATMOSPHERIC AND SOIL CONDITIONS FOR PREDICTION OF DAILY OPPORTUNITY WINDOWS FOR HARVEST OPERATIONS USING FIELD-LEVEL DIAGNOSIS AND PREDICTION OF WEATHER CONDITIONS AND OBSERVATIONS AND RECENT INPUT OF HARVEST CONDITION STATES

METHOD FOR PREDICTION OF SOIL AND/OR PLANT CONDITION

title: Multifunctional agriculture and forestry monitoring system
abstract: The invention provides a multifunctional agriculture and forestry monitoring system comprising an artificial intelligence cloud device, an information management and control device, an information detection device, and an information application device. The artificial intelligence cloud device is used to receive an agriculture and forestry problem request signal and agriculture and forestry detection information for big data analysis processing, and is used to output agriculture and forestry problem processing data. The information management and control device is used to receive the agriculture and forestry problem processing data, the agriculture and forestry detection information, the agriculture and forestry problem request signal, a video signal, and first voice information, and is used to output the agriculture and forestry detection information, control information, the agriculture and forestry problem processing data, and second voice information. The information detection device is used to receive the control information, and is used to output the agriculture and forestry detection information. The information application device is used to receive the control information and the agriculture and forestry problem processing data, and is used to output the first voice information, the agriculture and forestry problem request signal, and the video signal. The multifunctional agriculture and forestry monitoring system is advantageous in that agriculture and forestry technology regional sharing is improved, and for crops grown on soil, by combining soil and water quality with the growth habits of the crops, the growth cycles, the product ingredients, and the nutrient contents of the above mentioned crops are determined and predicted, and quality information is fed back to APP users and workers for big data accumulation on a cloud.

title: MODELING OF CROP GROWTH FOR DESIRED MOISTURE CONTENT OF BOVINE FEEDSTUFF AND DETERMINATION OF HARVEST WINDOWS FOR CORN EARLAGE USING FIELD-LEVEL DIAGNOSIS AND FORECASTING OF WEATHER CONDITIONS AND FIELD OBSERVATIONS

abstract: A modeling framework for evaluating the impact of weather conditions on farming and harvest operations applies real-time, field-level weather data and forecasts of meteorological and climatological conditions together with user-provided and/or observed feedback of a present state of a harvest-related condition to agronomic models and to generate a plurality of harvest advisory outputs for precision agriculture. title: Farmland irrigation intelligent decision making system and method
abstract: The invention relates to a farmland irrigation intelligent decision making system and method. The system comprises a soil moisture status data collection module, a time collection module, a soil moisture status grade calculating and modeling module, an irrigation decision making and processing module, a spatial distribution processing module and an interface display module. The soil moisture status grade calculating and modeling module establishes a soil moisture status grade calculating model and carries out soil moisture status grade calculation according to soil moisture status data collected by the soil moisture status data collection module and a crop practical growth phase determined by the time collection module. According to a soil moisture status grade calculation result, the irrigation decision making and processing module obtains an irrigation decision in such a manner that artificial intelligence and decision supporting are combined, the spatial distribution processing module carries out spatial distribution processing, and then the interface display module carries out interface display. By adopting the system, farmers and an agriculture department can respectively, precisely and pointedly grasp the soil moisture status information and the intelligent irrigation decision of a farmland in a base of a region anytime and anywhere.

title: Vertical rotation garage parking
applicants: BINZHOU QILIN FARMING MACHINERY CO LTD
abstract: The utility model relates to a machinery parking equipment field, concretely relates to vertical rotation garage parking, including vertical support, transmission, garage parking, controller, transmission is connected with the controller, its characterized in that: vertical support is equipped with two, is first vertical support and the vertical support of second respectively, all be equipped with the slide on every vertical support, all be equipped with a plurality of sliders on every slide to the position of slider, quantity one -to -one, horizontal hanging scroll of fixed connection all between the slider that corresponds on every slider on the first vertical support and the vertical support of second, connect the garage parking on the horizontal hanging scroll, every slider all cooperatees with transmission. The beneficial effects of the utility model are that: automatic high, stability is strong, reduce area in a large number, but the artificial intelligence remote control sets up the mechanically fastening device, can practice thrift the electric power resource.

abstract: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a method that can manufacture corresponding N-substituted amide compounds from various raw material compounds and amides safely at low cost.SOLUTION: Formula IIIa is formed by bringing formula Ia into contact with formula II exceeding two times equivalents of Ia, in the presence of an acid.

title: Temporary support for vine bush
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely to viticulture, especially to a temporary support for vine bush and can be applied in the plantations of bushes in the form of one-sided oblique cordon without trellis.The temporary support, according to the invention, is made in the form of a stake of a length of 250…300 cm, double-wrapped in a spiral with a plastic twine, consisting of perennial branch segments of a thickness of 35…45 mm and a length of 50…60 cm, each with a cavity of a depth of 40 mm at one end and pointed at the other end, connected in series by introduction of the pointed end of one segment into the cavity of another segment and rigidly fixed by means of fixing nodes of a length of 10…12 cm and a thickness of 9…11 cm, each of which is formed of six twigs of a thickness of 8…10 mm and a length of 8…10 cm, placed in a hardened plaster layer of a thickness of 30 mm, covered with a hardened cement layer of a thickness of 5 mm, and wrapped in a polyethylene film.

title: Method and device for measuring the growth in thickness of skeletal roots of the perennial plant
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely fruit growing, particularly to a method for measuring the growth in thickness of skeletal roots of the perennial plant and an apparatus for its implementation.The method, according to the invention, includes grubbing out of roots of the triennial plant to a radius of 60 cm from the root collar, measurement of root primary thickness, placement on roots of a thickness measuring device, which provides the root wrapping with a measuring twine, passed through a plastic tube located vertically, in which are made 2 holes on the upper end and lower at 15 cm, after which the ends of the twine are withdrawn out through the upper holes and tied with an elastic twine bred out through the lower hole. At the same time, on each horizontal skeletal root are installed 2 devices: one - at a distance of 10 cm from the root collar, the other - over 50 cm along the axial line of the root, and on each vertical skeletal root - one device at a distance of 10 cm from the root collar. The roots are buried in soil, placing the upper end of the device outside. It is carried out the measurement and registration of length of the measuring twines located outside, then in spring and in autumn is measured the length of the measuring twines located outside, and on the basis of changes in the length of twines is determined the thickness of the roots.

title: Device and process for the thinning of fruit tree buds
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely fruit growing, particularly to a device and process for the thinning of fruit tree buds.The device, according to the invention, includes a main frame (6), equipped with four tubular crossbars (22) - two on the left and two on the right, telescopically connected by means of tubular elements (5) with two spars (3, 4), each of which is equipped with three working tools in the form of mobile bars (15), wrapped in synthetic rubber, mounted on axles (27) and connected from one end to fixed crossbars (14) by means of spiral springs (16), as well as with three supporting boards (17), a bearing roller (12 ) and a self-regulating wheel (18). At the same time, the main frame (6) is connected by a coupling annular shackle (7) to a secondary frame (8), telescopically connected by two cylindrical elements (23, 24) to two limiting boards (10), each equipped with two supporting boards (11) and is equipped with two beams (25) for attachment to the tractor frame.The process, according to the invention, consists in that in the period between 7 and 25 June, is carried out shaking of the fruit trees by three successive blows on the trunks at a height of 30…45 cm from the soil surface by the working members of a device, according to the invention, fixed in the frontal part of the tractor when it moves between the row-spacing of the fruit trees.The result is to provide for the thinning of fruit tree buds, combined with other technological operations carried out in the garden.

title: Process for vine bush formation
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely viticulture, in particular to a process for vine bush formation by means of a temporary support and can be applied in plantations with vigorous varieties.The process, according to the invention, consists in the formation of vine bush (1) with 4 twigs (9, 10, 11, 12) in the second year after planting, to which in the third year after planting are tied temporary props (17, 18, 19, 20). The tops of the props of the neighboring bushes in the row are connected by twos via a flexible hose forming two pairs of props, oriented obliquely to the middle of the row-spacing on both sides of the row, and the apical parts of the pair of props of the neighboring rows reciprocally rest against each other with parts in the form of a roll (21). In the fourth year after planting on the twigs of the vine bush are formed off-shoots: longitudinal apical (25), longitudinal middle (26, 27) and transversal (28). In the fifth year after planting on all off-shoots of the twigs are formed short knots (29). The tops of the longitudinal off-shoots (25, 26, 27) of the neighboring vine bushes of one row, as well as the tops of the transverse off-shoots (28) of the neighboring twigs of the same bush are combined by interweaving and tying up.

title: Process for vine bush formation
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely viticulture, in particular to a process for vine bush formation using a temporary support and can be used for planting strong-growing varieties.The process, according to the invention, consists in the fact that simultaneously with vine bush planting near the underground trunk is obliquely placed a plastic tube, near each bush is buried during the first year in the row line one plastic hose (3) with the ends on the surface, through which is stretched a twine, and during the third year - one hose on the left and right side. The one-sided oblique cordon is shaped of a trunk (16), two lateral horns (14, 15) - bearers of transverse left (23) and right (24) arched arms, and a longitudinal horn (13), oriented in the row plane with a longitudinal arched shoulder (21) bent towards the trunk (16) and with the top attached to it. At the same time, in the spring of the fourth year in the plastic tube is installed a temporary support, to which is tied the trunk (16), forming a rigid structure obliquely oriented along the length of the row. The trunk (16) and support, as well as the longitudinal arched shoulder (21) are fixed by means of twines in the hose (3). The lateral horns (14, 15) are positioned at a height of 10 cm from the soil surface. The tops of the transverse arms (23, 24) are joined crosswise with the trunk (16). In the fifth year after planting on the longitudinal shoulder (21) are formed two horizontal arms (27, 28), which are tied to an arm (26) located in the upper part of the trunk (16) and hanging freely, and then in the seventh year after planting the horizontal arms (27, 28) are moved away.

title: Process and device for the manufacture of a mulch strip
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely to horticulture, in particular to a device and a process for the manufacture of a mulch strip.The device, according to the invention, comprises a frame (1), on which by means of brackets are installed: wedge-shaped spacers (4), consisting of two plates of a width of 4 cm, placed at an angle; rolls (7) with wire or plastic twine (6); rolls (5) for laying of wire or plastic twine on the soil surface; a grass pressing means (10), made in the form of a triangular shield; a roller (11) of a diameter of 15 cm for rolling the grass, installed with the possibility of vertical movement of its axis (17) in the groove of a bracket (26); a wire of a diameter of 3 mm or a passive blade (12) located transversely to the soil surface at a height of 3…5 cm under the wire or plastic twine; a roll (15) with a polyethylene film (28); a roll (13) of a diameter of 5 cm for the direction of polyethylene film movement; a roll (14) of a diameter of 5 cm for maintaining the wire or plastic twine and polyethylene film; an axle (21) for winding the mulch strip, installed with the possibility of its vertical movement in the groove of a bracket.

title: Process for soil tillage in perennial plantings
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely to horticulture, in particular to a process for soil tillage in perennial plantings. The process, according to the invention, includes the autumn or spring tillage of soil in the spaces between rows of plantings by means of a cultivator. The tillage is carried out in a band of a width of 55 cm on both sides of the row and includes the pruning of roots to a depth of 40 cm with a passive knife, mounted on the frame of the cultivator, and loosening of soil to a depth of 30 m with two loosening hoes, mounted near the knife at a distance of 5 cm. At the same time, the soil tillage is carried out every two years, beginning with the third year after planting at a distance of 0.5 m from the row line during the first tillage, with an increase in the corresponding distance from the row line by 0.2 m during each subsequent tillage until the bands of the tilled soil come together in the middle of the spaces between the rows of plants. The result is to simplify the soil maintenance technology, to provide the suspension of excessive decomposition of humus and to increase the productivity of perennial crops.

title: Process for directional formation of the root system in a portable vine
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely to viticulture, in particular to a process for directional formation of the root system in a portable vine.The process, according to the invention, consists in planting the vine in a container without bottom in the shape of a truncated cone, formed by a conical tube, composed of two symmetrical parts, in which are placed drains and a substrate. Then is moistened the substrate, is removed the conical tube after subsidence of the substrate, it is wrapped up in a strip of polyethylene film, and then is dug a hole of a depth of 25 cm and a diameter of 5 cm smaller than the diameter of the basal part of the container, at the bottom of which is placed a wire with the formation of a circle, one end of which is fastened to a stake and the other is left free on the outside and is filled the hole with soil. The container is set above the hole with subsequent earthing up, afterwards every two years, starting from the third year after planting, in the spring is carried out the pruning of vertical roots by pulling the free end of the wire with the formation of the root base of the vine.The result consists in providing conditions for the maximum distribution of skeletal roots in a limited volume of substrate, reducing the plant stress in the permutation process and providing the possibility of plant permutation at any moment of the cultivation period.

title: Process for directional formation of the root system in a portable perennial plant
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, in particular to a process for directional formation of the root system in a portable perennial plant, which can be used for initiation of vineyards, orchards, dendrological and ornamental plantings.The process for directional formation of the root system in a portable perennial plant includes bedding-out of plant roots in three cylindrical containers with nutrient medium of a height of 1.5 m and a diameter of 10…12 cm, combined in the form of a vertical tripod, made of plastic material and fitted with drains and twigs as a temporary support for annual increments of the plant, which are placed on the growth site by moving away the tripod basal parts by 25…30 cm, followed by cultivation, at the same time in the 10th year after planting the cylindrical containers are removed, and before permutation of plant it is carried out pruning of roots spread beyond the container at a depth of 10…20 cm.The result consists in increasing the individual productivity of plant, raising the level of control over plant growth and development, simplifying the plant permutation technology.

title: Device and process for the production of mulch film
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely to horticulture, in particular to a device and a process for the production of mulch film.The device, according to the invention, comprises a frame (6), on which are installed by means of consoles: a grass rolling roller (7), installed with the possibility of vertical movement of its axle (8) in the groove (9) of the console; a grass cutting device (10); a roller (12) with polyethylene film; a roller (17) for pressing the plant mass and directing the motion of polyethylene film; a grid and polyethylene film maintenance roller (13) and a mulch film winding axle (14), installed with the possibility of its vertical movement in the groove of the console.The process, according to the invention, includes covering, before the initial vegetation, of soil sown with perennial grass seeds or overgrown with weeds with a plastic net of a width of 100 cm and a diameter of meshes of at most 1 cm, and when the grass attains the height of 30 cm, with the device according to the invention is carried out rolling of grass simultaneously with its pulling and tearing out or cutting, covering of the resulting plant mass with a polyethylene film with the concomitant pressing of plant mass on the surface of the net and rolling of the obtained film.

title: Process for directional formation of the portable fruit treeroot system
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely to fruit-growing, in particular to a process for directional formation of the portable fruit tree root system.The process for directional formation of the portable fruit tree root system includes cultivation of the fruit tree in a container without bottom in the form of a vertical roll of a diameter of 100...120 cm and a height of 60...80 cm, with an interval between the turns of 10 cm, which is formed from a perforated polyethylene blade of a length of 8...10 m, on which is put on a wetted substrate, perpendicular to the width of the blade are placed plastic drainpipes of a diameter of 3 cm and 8 cm, it is placed the root part of the tree and is rolled, then on the placement location of the container is dug a hole of a depth of 25 cm and a diameter of 5 cm smaller than the diameter of the container, the bottom of which is lined with a wire forming a circle, one end of which is attached to a stake, and the other is left free from the outside, the hole is filled with fertilized soil and is installed the container above the hole with subsequent earthing up. Every two years, beginning with the third year after planting, in spring is carried out the pruning of vertical roots by pulling the free end of the wire, with the formation of the root base of plants.The result consists in providing conditions for maximum extension of skeletal roots in a limited volume of substrate and providing the possibility of plant permutation at any moment of the exploitation period.

title: Process and device for mulching and loosening of soil
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, in particular to mulching and loosening of soil in gardens.The process for mulching and loosening of soil, according to the invention, includes the removal of weeds, covering of soil in the garden using mulching and loosening devices, made in the form of a block of series-connected rectangular shields, fitted with ringed harrows, which are placed in the intervals between the rows of a width not exceeding 300 cm or on both sides of the rows of plants with periodic displacement of devices every 20 days along the row with the concomitant loosening of soil.The device for mulching and loosening of soil, according to the invention, is made in the form of a block of series-connected rectangular shields (2), containing flexible elements, formed of bundles of plant or artificial debris, wrapped in polyethylene film, of a diameter of 6...10 cm and a length of 50...300 cm, placed with partial overlap and attached perpendicularly to two parallel guides (1), to the ends of which are attached ringed harrows (4), and the distance between the shields (2) in the block is equal to the length of one shield.The result of the invention is to provide the mulching of soil with its concomitant loosening, as well as to facilitate the process of displacement of the mulching device.

title: Process and device for mulching and loosening of soil
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, in particular to mulching and loosening of soil in gardens.The process for mulching and loosening of soil, according to the invention, includes removal of weeds, covering of soil in the garden using mulching and loosening devices, made in the form of a disk fitted with a toothed harrow, which are installed on stakes with partial overlap in the intervals between the rows of plants of a width of at least 3 m, with periodic movement of devices every 20 days around the stakes with the concomitant loosening of soil.The device for mulching and loosening of soil, according to the invention, is made in the form of a disk, consisting of a wooden frame, made of interlaced plant debris in the form of two concentric rings with a diameter of the outer ring 10 cm smaller than the distance between the rows of plants and a diameter of the inner ring of 10...15 cm, the rings are interconnected by means of four linear elements, placed crosswise, at the same time two elements, which are lined up, are equipped with a toothed harrow, to the half-disk is attached a polyethylene film or plant debris, and to the outer ring of the half-disk are attached flexible elements of a diameter of 10...15 cm and a length of 60...80 cm, formed of bundles of plant or artificial debris, wrapped in polyethylene film and placed in partial overlap.The result of the invention is to provide the mulching of soil with its simultaneous loosening, as well as to facilitate the mulching device movement process.

title: Process for the production of grafted tree
applicants: INST PUBLICA INST STIINTIFICO PRACTIC HORTICULTURA TEHNOLOGII ALIMENTARE [MD]
INSTITU & TCEDIL IA PUBLIC & ABREVE INST & SCEDIL TIIN & TCEDIL IFICO PRACTIC DE HORTICULTUR & ABREV [MD]
abstract: The invention relates to agriculture, namely fruit growing, in particular to a process for the production of grafted trees using vegetative or generative stocks, intended for cultivation on vegetation plots and for initiation and use of conventional fruit plantations.The process for the production of grafted tree includes the preparation of the stock by dividing the cuttings of stock mother plant; obtaining and detachment of stock cuttings with roots in solid soil clod; preparation of the graft by detachment from the fruit-bearing tree of a big one-year or 2-3-year branch of a length of 1.2...1.5 m; the partial detachment from the base of the graft by longitudinal cuts of one or two stripes of rind of a width of 0.6...1.2 cm and a length of 5.5...8.0 cm and execution at the base of the graft of one or two oblique cuts of a length of 4.0...6.0 cm, giving the base the form of a wedge; execution of an oblique cut on the stock; grafting of the graft to the vegetative stock by joining the graft concomitantly with 2...4 stocks with the roots in solid soil clod with the covering of the middle parts of graft wedges, uncovered by the stocks, with stripes of rind, above which is longitudinally placed one twig of a thickness of 0.3...0.4 cm and a length of 8...10 cm, then it is tied the place of grafting, and the grafted tree is planted into a vegetative pot.

title: Bacteriocins and novel bacterial strains
applicants: STATE RES CENTER OF APPLIED MICROBIOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY [RU]
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA AS REPRESENTED BY THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE [US]
abstract: Novel bacteriocins and/or the novel lactic acid-producing strains are used for at least reducing the levels of colonization by at least one target bacteria in animals, especially poultry. 7-- I - IA Fig. I

title: 4-alkyl-substituted diaminopyrimidines
abstract: Use of 4-alkyl-substituted diaminopyrimidines of the formula (I) as fungicide in which R1 to R13 and X1 and X2 have the meanings given in the description, and agrochemically active salts thereof, and also methods and compositions for controlling phytopathogenic harmful fungi in and/or on plants or in and/or on seed of plants, processes for preparing such compositions and treated seed and also their use for controlling phytopathogenic harmful fungi in agriculture, horticulture and forestry, in the protection of materials and in the domestic and hygiene field. The present invention furthermore relates to a process for preparing diaminopyrimidines of the formulae (Ia), (Ib) and (Ic).

title: Automatic mobile robot for carrying field crops
abstract: The utility model discloses an automatic mobile robot for carrying field crops, which comprises a support plate, wherein the lower part of the support plate is connected with a drive wheel, and the upper part of the support plate is connected with at least one carrying bucket through a universal rotary device which can rotate around the center of the support plate freely. The robot is flexible automation or semi-automation equipment which mainly aims at completing the agricultural production task, and combines the movement of the four limbs of human, partial message perception and overprogram function together, a sensor technology, a monitoring technology, an artificial intelligence technology, a communication technology, an image recognition technology, a precision and system integration technology and various frontier scientific technologies are integrated into a whole, and the automatic mobile robot for carrying field crops shows great superiorities in improving the agricultural productivity, changing the agricultural production mode, solving the labor shortage problem, realizing the scale, diversification and precision of agriculture and the like.

title: 4-Alkyl-substituted diaminopyrimidines
abstract: Use of 4-alkyl-substituted diaminopyrimidines of the formula (I) as fungicide in which R1 to R13 and X1 and X2 have the meanings given in the description, and agrochemically active salts thereof, and also methods and compositions for controlling phytopathogenic harmful fungi in and/or on plants or in and/or on seed of plants, processes for preparing such compositions and treated seed and also their use for controlling phytopathogenic harmful fungi in agriculture, horticulture and forestry, in the protection of materials and in the domestic and hygiene field. title: 4-alkyl-substituted diaminopyrimidines
abstract: The invention the relates to the use of 4-alkyl-substituted diaminopyrimidines of the formula (I) as a fungicide, where R1 to R13, and X1 and X2 have the meanings specified in the description, and agrochemically effective salts thereof, and to methods and agents for controlling plant-pathogenic harmful fungi in and/or on plants or in and/or on seeds of plants, to methods for producing such agents and treated seeds, and to the use thereof for controlling plant-pathogenic harmful fungi in agriculture, horticulture, and forestry, in material protection, and in the household and hygiene area. The invention further relates to a method for producing diaminopyrimidines of the formulas (Ia), (Ib), and (Ic).

title: Artificial intelligence light supply apparatus used for atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
abstract: The utility model relates to artificial intelligence light supply apparatus used for an atomic fluorescence spectroscopy. The light supply apparatus comprises a light source socket and a light source inserted on the light source socket; a light source identification and control device electrically connected with the light source is arranged on the light source socket; the light source identification and control device is controlled by a 51-kernel singlechip and a drive circuit; and the light source is a hollow cathode lamp. The whole apparatus has a simple structure and a reasonable layout; users can conveniently identify and control the light source of an instrument, thereby obtaining the best operation condition of the atomic fluorescence spectroscopy; the operation and the use are convenient for the users. Therefore the artificial intelligence light supply apparatus is suitable for intelligently identifying and controlling the light source in atomic spectral analysis in the fields of environmental protection, clinical medicine, agriculture, geology, metallurgy, pharmaceutical manufacturing, petrochemical, and so on.

abstract: Phenylpyrazoles of the formula: <IMAGE> I <IMAGE> Ia in which: X=H, hal, NO2, CN, SCN, alkyl (C1-C4), alkenyl (C2-C4), alkynyl (C2-C4), alkoxy (C1-C4), alkylthio (C1-C4), phenyl, phenoxy; mono- or di- alkyl- or phenyl- amino; alkylcarbonyl, carbamoyl, carboxyl, benzoyl; alkyl- sulphinyl or sulphonyl; Y, Z=H, hal, OH, NO2, NO, CN, SCN, alkyl (C1-C4), alkenyl (C2-C4), alkynyl (C2-C4), alkoxy (C1-C4), alkylthio (C1-C4), phenyl, phenoxy; mono- or di- alkyl- or phenyl- amino; alkylcarbonyl, carbamoyl, carboxyl, benzoyl; alkyl- sulphinyl or sulphonyl, for example; and Y, Z may also form a bridge of 1 to 4 atoms, of which at least one can be a hetero atom, optionally substituted. title: Concept mapping based knowledge acquisition system and methods
abstract: An interlocking artificial intelligence system and methods including the present invention comprises a system and methods including, but not limited to: a) a presentation layer which attempts to contextualise the use of a database for a specific seeker of information and related to a specific activity, decision, context or situation, b) a mapping engine which carries out the primary tasks of linking up the seeker-context to the appropriate documents and search results from the database, and c) a database which comprises of numerous documents which include, but are not limited to all types of media such as paper or film and/or from numerous sources. The frameworks of concepts or objects can be updated routinely and the programs adapted to provide a knowledge-based system to build competency in diverse specialties including education, commerce, financing, e-commerce, health care, agriculture, real estate, navigation, traveling or industry operations in general.

title: Herbicidal isoxazole and 2-cyano-1,3-dione compounds
abstract: The invention relates to compounds of formulae (Ia), (Ib) or (Ic): <IMAGE> (Ia) <IMAGE> (Ib);The invention relates to compounds of formulae (Ia), (Ib) or (Ic): <IMAGE> (Ia) <IMAGE> (Ib) <IMAGE> (Ic) and to their use as herbicides.

title: Measurement of avian embryo movement in intact eggs
abstract: The present invention provides measurement of avian embryo movement in intact eggs by: directing light into and through at least one intact avian egg, with light of sufficient intensity and duration to stimulate embryo movement, whereby portions of the light exit the at least one intact avian egg; sensing instantaneous intensities of the portions of the light exiting each of the eggs, and; determining a ratio of, range of sensed light intensities (IR) to average sensed light intensities (IA), for each of the eggs. The ratio of IR:IA is a measure of avian embryo movement.

title: Plant growth regulating formulations
abstract: Plant growth regulating preparations comprising:(a) 0.1-20 wt. % of a 16,17-dihydro gibberellin of formula (Ia) or (Ib);(b) up to 99.9 wt. % of a formulation additive selected from:(b1) the reaction products of triglycerides based on carboxylic acids having 2-30C and ethylene oxide and/or propylene oxide in the presence of a base, and/or(b2) fatty acid alcohol polyethoxylates;(c) up to 50 wt. % of an organic solvent;(d) 0.1-50 wt. % of a formulation auxiliary different from (b1) and (b2);(e) up to 50 wt. % of additional plant growth regulating compounds can be used in agriculture and horticulture to induce the desired effects on, for example, seed germination and seedling growth, rooting, dormancy, juvenility, maturity and senescence, flowering, abscission of leaves, flowers and fruit, fruit set and development, tuber formation, growth of shoot and root, photoassimilation, control of unwanted plants and senescence of whole plants or single organs. The 16,17-dihydroGA's are used to synergize the biological activity of exogenously supplied gibberellins. Particularly in graminaceous species, the compounds synergize the action of exogenous GA's and can, thus, be used to increase the yield of malt and decrease the amount of time required for the malting process, increase the yield of sugar cane and stimulate germination and seedling development in rice, wheat, barley, oats, rye, maize, sorghum, turf grasses and other plant species.

title: PYRIMIDINETRIONE DERIVATIVES, AGENTS CONTAINING THEM AND THEIR USE AS AGENTS FOR COMBATING PESTS
abstract: Pyrimidinetrione derivatives, processes for their preparation, agents containing them and their use as agents for combating pests. Compounds of the formula I, tautomeric forms thereof of the formula Ia, stereoisomers thereof and the mixtures of these forms <IMAGE> (I) <IMAGE> (Ia) wherein R1 and R2 denote unsubstituted or substituted alkyl, alkenyl, alkynyl; alkoxy, alkylsulfonyl, alkylcarbonyl or cyano or optionally substituted phenyl, phenylsulfonyl or phenylcarbonyl, R3 denotes hydrogen, alkyl or optionally substituted phenyl, R4 denote H, OH, unsubstituted or substituted alkyl, alkenyl, alkynyl, phenylsulfonyl, phenylcarbonyl, phenylcarbamoyl or phenyl; alkylsulfonyl or alkylcarbonyl, which can be halogenated, alkylcarbamoyl or cyano, R5 and R6 denote halogen, alkoxy, alkylcarbonyl, alkoxycarbonyl, alkylsulfenyl, -sulfinyl or -sulfonyl, haloalkoxy, alkylamino, cyano, sulfo or nitro, A,X,Z and L denote oxygen, sulfur, sulfinyl, sulfonyl or nitrogen, which can be substituted by alkyl, or L denotes a double bond, M,D,E,Q and G denote carbon or nitrogen, V denotes carbon or substituted phosphorus, W denotes alkylene or haloalkylene, both of which can be substituted, Y1 denotes H, halogen, alkyl, alkylamino or hydroxyl, Y2 denotes oxygen, sulfur or nitrogen which is optionally substituted by alkyl and n amd m denote 0-4, and salts thereof which can be employed in agriculture or are physiologically tolerated, have advantageous actions against a broad spectrum or animal pests in agriculture and animal breeding.

The intelligent system also provides a framework for using the knowledge base build competency in diverse specialities (Figure 7).

title: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR GRINDING AND MIXING THE MATERIAL
abstract: The method for grinding and mixing of a material includes supply of liquid in a closed volume, production of the turbulent incompressible flow of liquid medium, loading of the material being ground, its grinding by mechanical way in the turbulent incompressible flow of liquid medium. The loading of the material is carried out partially, and grinding is performed under the action of hydroblow and cavitation pulse. Crushing mixing device contains a grinding chamber with grinding mechanism and an electric motor of the drive of grinding mechanism, a cone-shaped hopper is added to the device, the lower base of the hopper is less than the upper and is made with the inclination toward its side, in this case the sharp slope angle is located in the region of connecting the hopper with the grinding chamber; in the sealed chamber casing is located a mobile internal working wheel of the grinding mechanism, in which along the circumference are made the radially located through window-openings.

title: DERIVATIVES OF N-[4-(1-HYDROXY-1-TRIFLUOROMETHYL-2,2,2-TRIFLUOROETHYL)PHENYL- ]UREA SHOWING ANTIDOTE ACTIVITY TO 2-CHLORO-N-[(4-METHOXY-6-METHYL-1,3,5-TRIAZINE-2-YL)AMINOCARB- ONYL]BENZENE SULFAMIDE IN FLAX SOWING
applicants: VSESOJUZNYJ NAUCHNO-ISSLEDOVATEL'SKIJ INSTITUT KHIM SREDSTV ZASHCHITY RASTENIJ [RU]
abstract: FIELD: organic chemistry. SUBSTANCE: product - derivatives of N-[4-(1-hydroxy-1-trifluoromethyl-2,2,2-trifluoroethyl] urea of the formula (I): Ia: R- H; R-CH, R-CH, R-CHCH, empirical formula is CHFNO; Ib: R-CH, R-CH, R-H, R-CH, empirical formula is CHFNO. Reagent 1: corresponding derivatives of 4-(1-hydroxy-1-trifluoromethyl-2,2,2-trifluoroethyl)aniline. Reagent 2: methyl- or p-tolylisocyanate. Reaction conditions: organic solvent (diethyl ether, benzene, chloroform), at the room temperature or boiling for 7-48 h. Synthesized compounds are used in agriculture since product shows antidote effect to 2-chloro-N-[(4-methoxy-6-methyl-1,3,5-triazine-2-yl)benzene sulfamide]chlorosulfurone of the formula:. EFFECT: improved method of synthesis. 1 tbl

title: 2-(5-R-AMINOMETHYLFURYL-2)-1,3-DIOXALANES DISPLAYING GROWTH-REGULATING AND ANTI-STRESS ACTIVITY
abstract: FIELD: organic chemistry, agriculture. ^ SUBSTANCE: invention relates to chemistry of biologically active substances, in particular, to novel biologically active compounds, namely, 2-(5-R-aminomethylfuryl-2)-1,3-dioxalanes of the formula (I): wherein at (Ia) R means --Ts and at (Ib) R means -CO-Ph. These compounds show properties as activating agent with respect to germination of winter wheat grains of sort "Pobeda-50" possessing growth-regulating and anti-stress activity. ^ EFFECT: valuable biological properties of compounds. ^ 1 cl, 2 tbl, 2 ex

title: ФУНГИЦИДНЫЕ КОМБИНАЦИИ БИОЛОГИЧЕСКИ АКТИВНЫХ ВЕЩЕСТВ
FUNGICIDE MIXTURE AND METHOD OF CONTROL OF HARMFUL FUNGI
abstract: FIELD: organic chemistry, agriculture, fungicides. SUBSTANCE: invention describes fungicide mixture containing carboxylic acid ester oxime ether of the formula (Ia) <EMI ID=0.1 HE=30 WI=39 TI=CHI> or (Ib) <EMI ID=0.2 HE=35 WI=39 TI=CHI> and fungicide. Fungicide is dithiocarbamate (II) taken among the group involving: manganese-ethylenebis-(dithiocarbamate) (zinc complex) (IIa); manganese-ethylenebis-(dithiocarbamate) (IIb); zinc-ammiacate-ethylenebis-(dithiocarbamate) (IIc) and zinc-ethylenebis-(dithiocarbamate) (IId) taken at synergistic effective amount. Invention describes also method of control of harmful fungi. EFFECT: decreased dose of known compounds, broadened spectrum of their effect. 10 cl, 2 tbl

title: FACTOR ENHANCING PESTICIDE ACTIVITY OF THE STRAIN OF BACILLUS SPECIES, PESTICIDE COMPOSITION CONTAINING THEREOF, METHOD OF STRUGGLE AGAINST PESTS, METHOD OF PREPARING AND IDENTIFICATION OF THE STRAIN BACILLUS, MUTANT OF STRAIN BACILLUS AND METHOD OF ITS PREPARING
abstract: FIELD: microbiology, genetics, pesticides. SUBSTANCE: invention relates to factor enhancing pesticide activity of related Bacillus pesticide and methods of isolation and identification of this factor. Invention relates to pesticide preparations containing factor and methods of the use of pesticide preparations for struggle against insect-pests and decrease of pest resistance to pesticide and enhancement of related Bacillus pesticide. Factor can be obtained from Bacillus fermentation product. This factor corresponds to the formula (Ia). EFFECT: improved method of preparing, enhanced effectiveness of factor.

title: MICROBIOCIDES
abstract: FIELD: plant protection. SUBSTANCE: microbiocide agent of synergistic action has at least two active components. Component (I) is compound taken from the following group: (IA) - 1-[3-(2-chlorophenyl)-2-(4-fluorophenyl)oxirane-2-ylmethyl] -1H-1,2,4-triazole, ("Epoxiconazol"); (IB) - 4-(4-chlorophenyl)-2-phenyl-2-(1,2,4-triazole-1-ylmethyl)-butyronitrile, ("Fenbuconazol"); (IC) - 5 -(4-chlorobenzyl)-2,2-dimethyl-1-(1H-1,2,4-triazole-1-ylmethyl)-cyclopentanol, ("Metconazol"); (ID) - 2-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)-3-(1H-1,2,4-triazole-1-yl)-propyl -1,1,2,2-tetrafluoroet-hylether, ("Tetraconazol"); (IE) - α-[2-(4-chlorophenyl)-ethyl] -a-(1,1-dimethylethyl)-1H-1,2,4-triazole-1-ethanol, ("Tebuconazol"); (IF) - 1-[4-bromo-2-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)-tetrahydrofurfuryl]-1H-1,2,4-triazole, ("Bromuconazol"), or, respectively, one of its salts or metallocomplexes; and component (II) represents: (IIA) - 1-[2-(2,4-dichlorophenyl)-4-propyl-1,3-dioxalane-2-ylmethyl] -1H-1,2,4-triazole, ("Propiconazol") and/or (IIB) - 4-cyclopropyl-6-methyl-N-phenyl-2-pyrimidineamine, ("Cyprodinil"), or, respectively, one of its salts or metallocomplexes. EFFECT: enhanced effectiveness of microbiocides.

title: Pesticidal compounds related to 1-arylpyrazoles such as 5-amino-1-[2,6-dichloro-4-(trifluoromethyl)phenyl]-3-[(1,1-dimethoxy)ethyl]-4-methylthio-1H-pyrazole especially for controlling arthropods
abstract: Compositions comprising the compounds of Formula (I) and methods for use, particularly in agriculture and for animal protection as pesticides, especially for controlling arthropods. Wherein; R31 and R32 may individually be OR20, S(O)nR20, or N(R20)(R21); or R31 and R32 may also connect to form O[C(R22)(R23)]mO, S(O)n[C(R22)(R23)]mS(O)a, O(CH2)mS(O)n, O[C(R22)(R23)]m(NR20), S(O)n[C(R22)(R23)]m(NR20), NR21[C(R22)(R23)]mNR20, NR21 [C(O)(CH2)m]NR20; when m is greater than one, the groups [C(R22)(R23)] may be the same or different; R20, R21 may individually be H, alkyl, aryl, benzyl, allyl, propargyl; R22, R23 may individually be H; halogen; OH; NH2; COOR20; C(O)NH2; C(O)N(R20)(R21); C(S)NH2; OC(O)N(R20)(R21); CN; NO2; C(S)N(R20)(R21); alkyl which may optionally be substituted with OH, NH2, halogen, CN, NO2, COOR20, C(O)NH2, C(S)NH2; S(O)balkyl; alkoxy; S(O)cR20; R4 is R26; S(O)dR26; S(=R27)(=NR28)R26; R26 is alkyl optionally substituted with one or more halogen which may be the same or different; R5 is NH2, alkylamino where the alkyl may be substituted with NO2, halogen, CN, alkoxycarbonyl, OH, alkoxy, alkylthio, alkylsulfinyl, alkylsulfonyl or carbamoyl; or R5 is a radical having the Formula (Ia).

title: NON-CONTACT TYPE MOVING TABLE
abstract: PURPOSE:To form a non-contact type flat moving table having little bearing area by floating the moving table with compressed air and farming flat movement hard bearing by supplying with vacuum pressure so as to apply the moving table with external force. CONSTITUTION:When compressed air is supplied to an air supply pipe 5, it is supplied to an air supply groove 2b through an air supply opening 2g, which makes a moving table 2 float above guide surface Ia of a guide table 1. The moving table 2, however, is very unstable. Then, by performing vacuum suction from an air suction pipe 6, the gap between the guide surface 1a and a moving surface 2a becomes smaller than a vacuum suction opening 2h, as a result, stronger resistance against the compression force and stretching force from above the moving table 2 is obtained, so that flat movement hard bearing is obtained. Then, when the moving table 2 is applied with external lateral force, it is moved in the same direction as the applied external force.

title: PERHYDROIMIDAZOTHIAZOLE DERIVATIVE* ITS PREPARATION AND AGRICULTURAL AND HORTICULTURAL FUNGICIDE CONTAINING THE SAME
abstract: NEW MATERIAL:A 6-(3, 5-dichlorophenyl) perhydroimidazo [5, 1-b] thiazole derivative I(R is 2-4C alkyl; X is O or S; n is 0,1 or 2). EXAMPLE:6-(3, 5-Dichlorophenyl) perhydroimidazo [5, 1-b] thiazole-5, 7-dione. USE:A fungicide for agriculture and horticulture. It is effective for gray mold of vegetables, rice blast disease, etc. It is almost free from phytotoxicity for plants and has low toxicity for men and beasts. PROCESS:Thiazolidine-2-carboxylic acid or its lower alkyl ester is reacted with 3, 5-dichlorophenyliso (thio) cyanate to give the compound II. The compound II is subjected to the condensation-cyclization e.g. by heating it in the presence of an acid or by heating it in acetic anhydride in the presence of sodium acetate, to give the compound Ia. The compound Ib is prepared by further the oxidation of the compound Ia.

title: DERIVATIVE OF PYRAZOLYLPYRIMIDINE
abstract: NEW MATERIAL:A derivative of pyrazolylpyrimidine of formula I [R1=H, lower alkyl, phenyl; R2=H, lower alkyl; R3=amino, formula III (R4, R5=H, lower alkyl, phenyl, halogen-substituted phenyl, lower alkyl-substituted phenyl, R4 and R5 can form a ring together)]. EXAMPLE:A compound of formula I (R1=H, R2=H, R3=NH2). USE:Germicides for agriculture and horticulture, extremely effective to e.g. rice blast, powdery mildew of cucumber etc., and non-toxic to crops, man, beast and fish. PROCESS:A 6-chloro compound of formula II is heated in ethanol, isopropanol etc., to give a hydrazino compound of formula Ia which is then heated in a ketone in the presence or absence of an acid, to affort a hydrazone compound of formula Ib (R4, R5=lower alkyl).

title: Herbicidal pentafluorosulfanyl compounds
abstract: Compounds of formulae (Ia), (Ib) or (Ic): ```in which the various symbols are as defined in the description, and salts and metal complexes thereof are useful as herbicides. Certain intermediates are also novel compounds.

title: New aminoquinoline-antibiotic hybrids, useful as antibacterials in human and veterinary medicine, disinfectants and in agriculture
abstract: Aminoquinoline-antibiotic hybrid compounds (I) are new. Aminoquinoline-antibiotic hybrid compounds of formula Q-(Y1)p-(U)p'-(Y2)p''-A (I) are new Q : aminoquinoline residue; p, p', p'' : 0 or 1 Y1, Y2, U : bond or linking group; and A : residue of an antibiotic. The full definitions are given in the DEFINITIONS - Full Definitions field. An independent claim is also included for a method of preparing (I) by fixing the -(Y1)p-(U)p'-(Y2)p''- group to one of Q and A, and reacting the product with the other of A and Q; or by attaching a group amino--(Y1)p-(U)p'-(Y2)p''- to Q and reacting the product with A. ACTIVITY : Antibacterial. The compound (2S,5R,6R)-6-{[1-(7-chloroquinolin-4-yl)piperidine-4-carbonyl]amino}-3,3-dimethyl-7-oxo-4-thia-1-aza-bicyclo[3,2,0]heptane-2-carboxylic acid 2,2-dimethylpropionyloxymethyl ester (Ia) had MIC and minimum bactericidal concentration against Staphylococcus aureus MSSA CIP 4.83 of 0.012 and 0.49 mu g/ml, respectively. MECHANISM OF ACTION : None given.

title: New saccharide or sugar alcohol derivatives containing O-ortho-salicyloyl group and O-n-alkanoyl group, useful for treating or preventing enterocolitis or intestinal adeno-carcinoma
abstract: New saccharide or sugar alcohol derivatives (I) contain one O-ortho-salicyloylated hydroxy group and one O-n-alkanoylated hydroxy group, the remaining hydroxy groups being free and/or protected. Saccharide or sugar alcohol derivatives of formula (I) are new. [Image] Sub : substrate selected from optionally protected, cyclic or acyclic saccharide derivatives and optionally protected, cyclic or acyclic saccharide derivatives; R1CO : ortho-acetyl-salicyloyl; R21-17C n-alkyl (preferably butyl); PG : hydroxy-protecting group of ether, ester or dioxolan-type acetal type; i : number of hydroxy groups in Sub (other than those substituted by R1CO or R2CO); j : number of protected hydroxy groups in Sub (possibly zero); and z : number of groups P' able to be carried by Sub, z being from 1 to j. ACTIVITY : Antiinflammatory; Cytostatic. Administration of crude 1-O-ortho-acetylsalicyloyl-3-O-n-butanoyl-D,L-glycerol (Ia) to a group of 25 rabbits subject to epizootic enterocolitis at 2 kg per tonne of feed for 67 days provided survival rates of 24/25 after 49 days, 22/25 after 55 days, 21/25 after 58 days and 11/25 after 67 days. The corresponding values for an untreated control group of rabbits were 16/25 after 49 days, 12/25 after 55 days, 7/25 after 58 days and 4/25 after 67 days. The average meat yield of the surviving rabbits was 22 % in the (Ia)-treated group than in the control group. MECHANISM OF ACTION : None given.

title: Bis(beta-hydroxy phenethyl)amines.
abstract: A compound of formula (I): < CHEM > or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt thereof, in which each of R<1> and R<2>, which may be the same or different, is hydrogen, halogen, or trifluoromethyl, R<3> ia hydrogen or methyl < CHEM > or an ester or amide derivative thereof, in which a is an integer from 1 to 6 b is an integer from 2 to 7 R<5> and R<6> are each hydrogen or C1-6 alkyl, or < CHEM > together form a five or six membered ring, X is -O- or a bond and n is 1 or 2 a process for preparing such compounds and their use in medicine and agriculture.

abstract: The invention relates to 4-aroylisoxazole derivatives of formula (Ia) or to 2-cyano-1,3-dione derivatives of formula (Ib): <CHEM> wherein R, R<1>, R<2>, X, Y and Z are as defined in the description, and to their use as herbicides.

title: Bis(beta-hydroxy phenethyl)amines.
abstract: A compound of formula (I): <CHEM> or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt thereof, in which each of R<1> and R<2>, which may be the same or different, is hydrogen, halogen, or trifluoromethyl, R<3> ia hydrogen or methyl; <CHEM> or an ester or amide derivative thereof, in which a is an integer from 1 to 6 b is an integer from 2 to 7 R<5> and R<6> are each hydrogen or C1-6 alkyl, or <CHEM> together form a five or six membered ring, X is -O- or a bond and n is 1 or 2; a process for preparing such compounds and their use in medicine and agriculture.

In formula (Ia) R represents hydrogen or -CO2R<1>, R<1> represents a straight or branched chain alkyl group containing from 1 to 6 carbon atoms and n = 0, 1 or 2.

abstract: The invention relates to 4-benzoylisoxazole derivatives of formula (Ia), 5-phenylisoxazole derivatives of formula (Ib) and 2-cyano-1,3-dione derivatives of formula (Ic), wherein R<1>, R<2>, R<3>, X and n are as defined in the description, and to their use as herbicides.
